alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 8:38PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FAIRFIELD AND EASTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM EDT... At 838 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Fairfield Beach, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newark, Heath, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Millersport, Pleasantville, Hanover, Fairfield Beach, Harbor Hills, Marne, Thornport, Thurston, Rushville, Gratiot, West Rushville, Toboso, Brownsville, State Route 158 at State Route 204 and Interstate 70 at State Route 37. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 124 and 142, and near mile marker 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
